Package aa.test.api

Class BasicApiTest

java.lang.Object
aa.test.api.AAApiTest
aa.test.api.BasicApiTest
@ExtendWith(org.mockito.junit.jupiter.MockitoExtension.class) class BasicApiTest extends AAApiTest
The Basic API test bypasses the frontend and communicates directly with the backend using the AllActivity Java GraphQL client. The purpose is to test low level integration between client and the backend, and basic scenarios which the AllActivity Java app requires for its functioning.

  • Method Details

    • test00GetConfiguration

      @Test void test00GetConfiguration() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Get Configuration.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and retrieve configuration for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Getting configurations from the server
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User requests their configuration using a GraphQL call
   Then The configurations will be returned not null and not empty
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test01aSuccessTimeEntryClient

      @Test void test01aSuccessTimeEntryClient() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Time Entry Success synchronous.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and save time entries there for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Client sends valid entries using a synchronous call and the entries are accepted
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User sends two valid time entries to the server using a GraphQL call
   Then The server will return a success response 
    And both entries will be marked as successfully reported 
    And no entries are marked as failed
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test01bAsyncTimeEntryClientBlocking

      @Test void test01bAsyncTimeEntryClientBlocking() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Time Entry Success asynchronous blocking.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and save time entries there for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Client sends valid entries using an asynchronous blocking call and the entries are accepted
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User sends two valid time entries to the server using a GraphQL call
   Then The server will return a success response asynchronously 
    And both entries will be marked as successfully reported 
    And no entries are marked as failed
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test01bAsyncTimeEntryClientSubscribe

      @Test @Disabled("Until the TODO is resolved. Success mock is not invoked.") void test01bAsyncTimeEntryClientSubscribe() throws Throwable
       Time Entry Success asynchronous non-blocking.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and save time entries there for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Client sends valid entries using an asynchronous non-blocking call and the entries are accepted.
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User sends two valid time entries to the server using an asynchronous GraphQL call
   Then The client will invoke the success consumer
    And The client will not invoke the fail consumer 
    And The exception handler will not process any uncaught exceptions
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception
      Throwable

    • test02ErrorTimeEntryClient

      @Test @Disabled("Waiting for the server side with proper error codes") void test02ErrorTimeEntryClient() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Time Entry Failure
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and save time entries there for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Invalid or colliding time entries should be refused
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User sends multiple entries with a time overlap using a GraphQL call
   Then The server will return a success response 
    But Only one entry has succeeded reporting
    And The three invalid entries will be marked as failed
    And a proper reason code will be given for each of the failures
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test03timeEntryCollision

      @Test @Disabled("The server currently doesn\'t check for collisions") void test03timeEntryCollision() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Time Entry Failure collisions outside one call 
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and save time entries there for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Client sends a time entry unique in this batch, but the entries collide with older entries already in the database.
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User sends two time entries colliding with existing entries to the server using a GraphQL call
   Then The server will return a success response 
    But no entry will be returned as successfully reported
    And both colliding entries will be marked as failed 
    And a proper reason code will be given for each of the failures
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test03AllProjectClient

      @Test @Disabled("enable when projects exist the test DB") void test03AllProjectClient() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException
       Get All Projects.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and retrieve all projects for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Getting user's all projects from the server
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User requests their top projects using a GraphQL call
   Then The projects will be returned not null and not empty
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test03bTopProjects

      @Test void test03bTopProjects() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException
       Get Top Projects.
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and retrieve top projects for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: Getting user's top projects from the server
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User requests their top projects using a GraphQL call
   Then The top projects will be returned not null
    But the top projects can be empty for users that haven't been active on any projects
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception

    • test05QuerySearch

      @Disabled("Known issue: GraphQL query timeEntryExists where condition is broken") @Test void test05QuerySearch() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, NumberFormatException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Test time entry search
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and search for a time entry according to its details
 
 Scenario: Checking whether a time entry with given parameters exists
   Given User is logged in with a valid session
   When User requests a check for an existing entry using a GraphQL call
   Then The call should succeed and return true
   But When User requests a check for an non-existing entry using a GraphQL call
   Then The call should succeed and return false
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception
      NumberFormatException

    • test99FiveMinClientTokenRefresh

      @Test @Disabled("Too long to execute due to sleep, should only execute on-demand.") void test99FiveMinClientTokenRefresh() throws aa.graphql.error.AAException, InterruptedException, aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException
       Authorization token refresh
 
 Feature: The client can connect to the backend and retrieve top projects for the logged in user.
 
 Scenario: It should be possible to refresh the authentication token
   Given User is logged in with a valid session (= has a valid refresh token)
   When The time since token issue is less than five minutes
   Then The test calls should succeed and be authorized
   But When The time since token issue is more than five minutes
   Then the test calls should fail with a HTTP 401 unauthorized
      Throws:
      aa.graphql.error.AAException - the standard AA exception
      aa.graphql.error.AANetworkException - an intermittent network-driven AA exception
      InterruptedException
